alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 11 at 6:00AM AKDT until October 13 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Coastal erosion and minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast including Utqiagvik. * WHEN...From 10 AM Tuesday to 4 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...At Utqiagvik, water may wash over low lying roads along the coast. Damage to fish or hunting camps along the coast may occur. Significant coastal erosion is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels are expected to rise 2 to 3 above the normal high tide line. Flooding could approach what occurred with last weeks storm. West winds of 25 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph will cause waves to crash onto the beach and push water into low lying areas inland from the beach. The worst conditions are expected to be tonight through Wednesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Precautions should be taken to protect property. Residents should pull possessions well off the beach.
